author: Timothy Puko
title: Senators grill EPA chief Scott Pruitt over long list of allegations - MarketWatch
text:
WASHINGTON—Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, continued to defend himself on Wednesday against a growing list of allegations involving management missteps and spending at the agency, denying some and deflecting others in a Senate subcommittee hearing.
Sen. Tom Udall (D., N.M.) counted up 16 continuing federal reviews of Mr. Pruitt’s actions, including two at the White House. They range from issues involving travel and security costs, to personnel moves at the agency and how he obtained rental housing...
